definitions.definition: A mixture; a confusion; a garble.
definitions.example: The muddle of nervous speech he uttered did not have much meaning.

definitions.definition: A mixture of crushed ingredients, as prepared with a muddler.
To mix together, to mix up; to confuse.
definitions.example: Young children tend to muddle their words.

definitions.definition: To mash slightly for use in a cocktail.
definitions.example: He muddled the mint sprigs in the bottom of the glass.

definitions.definition: To think and act in a confused, aimless way.
To cloud or stupefy; to render stupid with liquor; to intoxicate partially.
To waste or misuse, as one does who is stupid or intoxicated.
